EDUCATION.Institute Name: Maulana Abul Kalam Azad University of Technology, West Bengal formerly WBUT

PROJECTS TAKEN.Description:
Designed a model to categorise an image into one of the eight emotion classes namely anger, awe, fear, joy, sadness, disgust, trust and anticipation 
Tensorflow framework was used to implement a model that utilizes CNN and RNN with GRU cell. CNN extracts low, middle and global level features and RNN exploits the dependency among the three levels of features
Technologies : Python and PyCharm
The aim was to mimic the working of an ATM machine using J2SE with GUI.

PROJECTS TAKEN.Title of Project: Comparative study of Prediction models of Cardiac Arrhythmia
PROJECTS TAKEN.Description:
Performed a comparative study among various classifiers for predicting Cardiac Arrhythmia.
Implemented Naive-Bayes and Artificial Neural Networks & designed Support Vector Machine, Decision Tree and Random Forest.
Technologies : Python and PyCharm

Created an alarm system which goes off when an object comes too near to the given subject
Arduino Uno board was used to program the hardware and to set variable threshold distance, Infrared sensor was used for distance detection and buzzing the alarm
Technologies : Arduino IDE and C

PROJECTS TAKEN.Title of Project: Machine Learning and Systems for Critical Path Minimization
PROJECTS TAKEN.Description: The surge of Machine learning with advanced com-putation power has opened many doors in the field of ComputerAided  Design  (CAD)  and  VLSI  design.  Machine  learning  hasproved   to   be   a   dominant   method   for   building   models   thatcan provide precise and accurate predictions. Integrated Circuitmanufacturing  and  design  has  astounding  high  complexity  andenormous amount of data involved, adaptation of machine learn-ing  algorithms  in  IC  design  stages  can  provide  fast  predictionsand  substantial  gain  in  time.In  this  paper  we  review  retiming  algorithm  for  criticalpath  minimization,  and  see  how  it  can  be  benefited  from  MLalgorithms. We enlighten key challenges in doing so and discussthe potential approaches. We discuss regarding the input featurevector which has to be extracted and the output to be generated.We  also  talk  about  schemes  to  generate  more  samples  for  theproblem  and  a  method  to  verify  the  generated  circuits

Designed and Implemented a software which takes ISCAS89 circuits and converts them to verilog files which can be used for further testing.
The results of the software were compared with the standard results and it was found that the software can be used to convert different circuits to verilog.
Technologies : Verilog, Visual Studio, Xilinx Vivado and C++

PROJECTS TAKEN.Title of Project: Automatic Register Balancing in Model-based High-Level Synthesis
PROJECTS TAKEN.Description:
The objective is to manipulate the latency of a circuit using register balancing, which has been suitably mapped to global retiming problem
Present Work : Implemented standard global retiming algorithm
Future work : Aim is to integrate ISCAS89 to Verilog converter to the above project and to measure the accuracy and resource consumption
Technologies : Python, PyCharm, C++ and Visual Studio

Developed and Implemented a voice controlled calculator with basic arithmetic operations with two operands.
The codebook was trained with more than 100 voices and Viterbi's algorithm (HMM) was used to get to the most desired state of the unknown speech sample.
Technologies : Visual Studio and C++

Our planned upgrades:
1. Designing a GUI for the model.
2. Extend the numbers to double digits.
